verses.roman:
kiṁ na paśyata rāmasya
mukham ātāmra-locanam
muṣṭikaṁ prati sāmarṣaṁ
hāsa-saṁrambha-śobhitam

synonyms: kim—why; na paśyata—do you not see; rāmasya—of Lord Balarāma; mukham—the face; ātāmra—like copper; locanam—with eyes; muṣṭikam—Muṣṭika; prati—toward; sa-amarṣam—with anger; hāsa—by His laughter; saṁrambha—and His absorption; śobhitam—beautified.
translation: Don't you see the face of Lord Balarāma, with its eyes copper-red from His anger toward Muṣṭika and its beauty enhanced by His laughter and His absorption in the fight?
